result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan John Parks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Posts or Publishes Depiction of Person w/out Consent, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 942.09(3m)(a)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to any sentence; straight time.

miscConds.notes:
- Pay all costs/surcharges including the DNA surcharge during probation or to be docketed as a civil judgment/tax intercept.  Any cash bail posted on this case to be applied to costs and surcharges owed.
- Pay all supervision fees
- Restitution set at zero.

- No contact with the victim.
- No violations of the law rising to the level of probable cause

- Comply with any treatment or programming ordered by probation.
- Provide DNA sample

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ryan John Parks in court.  Attorney Michael F. Hart in court for Ryan John Parks.  Attorney Jack Eichorst for Jessica Bellows in court for State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm 
Plea and Sentencing held.  State compliant with Victim notification.
Defendant changes his plea to NO CONTEST.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, that a plea of guilty or no contest to the crime you are charged may result in deportation, exclusion from admission to this country, or the denial of naturalization under federal law is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant as to sentencing.
Court ordered defendant to serve 5 MONTHS in the House of Correction consecutive to any sentence; straight time; credit for -0- days served.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on probation for 9 MONTHS with the following conditions:
- Comply with any treatment or programming ordered by probation
- No contact with the victim
- Seek and maintain full-time employment.
- No violations of the law rising to the level of probable cause.
- Pay all costs/surcharges including the DNA surcharge during probation or to be docketed as a civil judgment/tax intercept.  Any cash bail posted on this case to be applied to costs and surcharges owed.
- Provide DNA sample.
- Pay all supervision fees
- Restitution set at zero.


Received and filed:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  bm
Elements of the Offense received and filed.  bm
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights received and filed.  bm
Victim Impact Statement.  Received and Filed.  nk

Defendant Ryan John Parks in court.  Attorney Michael F. Hart in court for Ryan John Parks.  Attorney Jessica Bellows in court for State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm  
Pretrial conference held.  Defense requests a plea and sentencing date.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 09-15-2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with AEJ.

Defendant Ryan John Parks in court.  Attorney Michael F. Hart in court for Ryan John Parks.  Prosecuting attorney Owen M Piotrowski in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Borowski, Branch 12.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 12.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
